title: 7 Days in Baja California Sur
subtitle: Desert Landscapes, Whale Watching & Beach Paradise
meta_title: Baja California Sur 7-Day Itinerary - Los Cabos, La Paz & Todos Santos
meta_description: Explore Baja California Sur in 7 days: Los Cabos beaches, Todos Santos art scene, La Paz whale sharks, and stunning desert-meets-ocean landscapes. Complete day-by-day guide.
hero_alt: El Arco rock formation at Land's End in Cabo San Lucas
introduction: Baja California Sur is Mexico's final frontier—a dramatic peninsula where the desert plunges into two seas, whales come to give birth, and artistic communities thrive in oasis towns. This 7-day itinerary combines the resort energy of Los Cabos with the bohemian soul of Todos Santos and the natural wonders of La Paz, creating the perfect Baja experience.
best_time: December to April for whale watching and perfect weather
highlights: Watch whales at close range in Magdalena Bay
Swim with whale sharks in La Paz
Kayak with sea lions at Espíritu Santo
See El Arco at Land's End
Taste farm-to-table cuisine in Todos Santos

days.title: Arrive in Los Cabos
days.description: Fly into Los Cabos International Airport (SJD) and transfer to San José del Cabo, the quieter, more charming of the two Cabos. Check into your hotel and explore the historic art district with its colonial church, galleries, and Thursday Art Walk (if timing allows). Dine at one of the excellent restaurants on the plaza.
activities: Check in to San José del Cabo hotel
Dinner at Flora Farms or Mi Casa
tips: San José del Cabo has more character than Cabo San Lucas—stay here for a better experience
Thursday Art Walk runs November-June from 5-9pm
Rent a car if you want flexibility (recommended)

days.title: Los Cabos Exploration
days.location: Cabo San Lucas / San José del Cabo
days.description: Morning boat trip to El Arco, the iconic rock formation at Land's End where the Pacific meets the Sea of Cortez. Visit Lover's Beach (bring snorkel gear), then head to Cabo San Lucas marina for lunch. Afternoon on the beach or snorkeling at Chileno Bay. Return to San José for sunset and dinner.
activities: Boat trip to El Arco (Land's End)
tips: Glass-bottom boats or water taxis to El Arco cost $15-25 round trip
Chileno Bay is the best snorkeling on the corridor—free access
Don't miss the sunset from the rooftop at Casa Natalia

days.title: Todos Santos Art Town
days.description: Drive the scenic Highway 19 to Todos Santos (1 hour). This Pueblo Mágico is Baja's bohemian heart—galleries, organic farms, surf beaches, and the legendary Hotel California. Explore the art-filled streets, visit the famous hotel, and dine at one of the acclaimed farm-to-table restaurants.
activities: Sunset drinks at Hotel San Cristóbal
tips: Hotel California's courtyard bar is worth a visit regardless of the Eagles connection
Cerritos Beach (15 min south) is excellent for beginner surfing
Make dinner reservations—top restaurants book up

days.title: Todos Santos & Farms
days.description: Morning surf lesson at Cerritos Beach or yoga session. Visit one of the organic farms that supply the town's restaurants—Huerta Los Tamarindos offers tours and a farm restaurant. Afternoon gallery hopping or hiking in the Sierra de la Laguna foothills. Evening cooking class or special dinner.
tips: Book surf lessons through Mario's Surf School
Farm tours should be arranged in advance
Try to catch the Saturday morning farmers market

days.title: Drive to La Paz
days.description: Drive north to La Paz (1.5 hours), the state capital and a completely different vibe—authentic Mexican city life meets stunning bay. Walk the beautiful Malecón at sunset, browse the shops downtown, and enjoy fresh seafood at one of the waterfront restaurants.
tips: La Paz feels like 'real Mexico' compared to Los Cabos—embrace it
The Malecón sunset is spectacular
Book tomorrow's whale shark or sea lion tour tonight

days.title: Marine Wildlife Adventure
days.description: This is the wildlife highlight of Baja. Choose between swimming with whale sharks (September-April) or kayaking with sea lions at Isla Espíritu Santo (year-round). Both are bucket-list experiences. The whale sharks are gentle giants; the sea lions are playful pups. Return exhausted and exhilarated.
activities: Espíritu Santo kayaking with sea lions
tips: Whale shark tours run October-April (peak December-February)
Sea lion tours are year-round and equally amazing
Book through reputable operators like The Cortez Club or Fun Baja

days.title: Balandra Beach & Departure
days.description: Visit Balandra Beach, consistently rated one of Mexico's most beautiful beaches—a protected bay with shallow turquoise water, white sand, and the famous mushroom rock. Spend the morning in paradise, then drive back to Los Cabos airport (2 hours) for your departure flight.
tips: Arrive at Balandra early (before 10am) for best parking and fewer crowds
Bring snacks and water—no services at the beach
Allow 2.5 hours for the drive to SJD airport with buffer

practical_info.getting_there: Fly into Los Cabos International Airport (SJD). Major airlines serve SJD from most US cities and many international destinations. La Paz has a small airport (LAP) with limited connections.
practical_info.getting_around: Rent a car—essential for this itinerary. Roads are excellent and scenic. The toll-free highway between Cabos and La Paz is safe and beautiful. Some tour operators provide transport from hotels.

faqs.question: When is whale watching season in Baja?
faqs.answer: Gray whales visit Baja's Pacific lagoons (Magdalena Bay, San Ignacio) from December to April, with February being peak season. Whale sharks are in the Sea of Cortez near La Paz from October to April. Humpback whales pass through Los Cabos November to March.

faqs.question: Is it safe to swim with whale sharks?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Whale sharks are gentle filter feeders—they eat plankton, not people. They can grow up to 40 feet but are completely docile. Reputable operators follow strict guidelines for safe, respectful encounters.

faqs.question: Can I do this trip without a car?
faqs.answer: It's possible but limiting. You could base in Los Cabos and take day tours to Todos Santos and La Paz. However, a rental car gives you flexibility to explore at your own pace and stop at scenic viewpoints along the way.

faqs.question: Is Los Cabos expensive?
faqs.answer: The Cabo corridor has resort pricing—expect to pay US-level prices at hotels and high-end restaurants. However, Todos Santos and La Paz are more affordable, and tacos are cheap everywhere. A mid-range trip is very doable.
